virtual sxsdk::master_surface_class& sxsdk::scene_interface::create_sub_surface ( const char *  as,
void *  aux = 0 
) [virtual]

Creates a sub surface object.

Creates a sub object that partially overrides the surface attributes of its parent object. For example, if you call create_sub_surface when the intersion point is at a polygon mesh object, a new sub surface object for the polygon mesh object is created, and the intersion point remains to be at the polyton mesh object.

Parameters:
as Name

Creates a curved surface part.

virtual sxsdk::mat4 sxsdk::scene_interface::get_sequence_world_to_device_matrix ( float  sequence_value,
void *  aux = 0 
) const [virtual]

The matrix to transform from the world coordinates to the device coordinates.

The matrix that rotates, moves, and normalizes the world coordinates based on the camera position, direction, and bank. The eye position is equal to the origin, and the eye direction is the Z axis.

Device coordinates, here, mean the coordinates of the rendering image (with the origin at the upper left corner and in pixel unit).

Parameters:
sequence_value sequence value
virtual sxsdk::mat4 sxsdk::scene_interface::get_sequence_world_to_perspective_matrix ( float  sequence_value,
void *  aux = 0 
) const [virtual]

The matrix that transforms the the view coordinate system of the camera to the world coordinate system.

The matrix that rotates, moves, and normalizes the world coordinates based on the camera position, direction, and bank. The eye position is equal to the origin, and the sight line is the Z axis.

Normalizes the coordinates so that they fit in the field of view with -1.0 to 1.0 vertically and horizontally, and going from 0.0 to 1.0 deep. Because coordinates outside these boundaries are outside the field of view, clipping occurs in this coordinate system.

Parameters:
sequence_value sequence value
virtual sxsdk::mat4 sxsdk::scene_interface::get_sequence_world_to_view_matrix ( float  sequence_value,
void *  aux = 0 
) const [virtual]

The matrix that transforms the world coordinate system to the view coordinate system of the camera.

The matrix that rotates, moves, and normalizes the world coordinates based on the camera position, direction, and bank. The eye position is equal to the origin, and the sight line is the Z axis.

The Perspective conversion is irrelevant.

Parameters:
sequence_value sequence value

virtual sxsdk::mat4 sxsdk::scene_interface::get_user_to_world_matrix ( void *  = 0  )  const [virtual]

Get The matrix to transform from the user coordinates to the world coordinates.

User coordinates are the coordinates as displayed in the Figure window factoring in the rokuro, local and global mode.

Used when factoring in the rokuro rotation for moving objects. The reverse transformation is done with get_world_to_user_matrix().
